Close David, close!!  This bloke may have read of Kiyomaro's arrangement to produce 100 swords for his patron Kubota Sugane around 1840. These were called "Buki Ko Ichi Hyaku No Ichi".  See page 287 of  "The Connoisseur's Book of Japanese Swords" by Koukan Nagayama for the details.  Apparently only one such "Buki Ko" has been found and the gentleman who started this thread may believe he has found another...

Regards,
Barry Thomas.
